CORE-defined Business Scenario - Descrip: Billed Service Not Covered by Health Plan
Denial Information: Procedure/diagnosis code inconsistencies, invalid codes, or billing errors
ACTION: Verify Place of Service (POS) code matches the procedure and type of bill.
APPEAL_TIPS: Submit documentation showing service was appropriately performed at the billed location; provide facility records if needed.
COMMON_CAUSES: POS code doesn't match facility type; telehealth POS incorrect; office vs. facility billing error; ASC vs. hospital outpatient mismatch.
PREVENTION: Set POS defaults based on facility type in EMR; add POS validation rules to billing system.

PREVENTION: Implement gender-based diagnosis filters; verify gender matches between clinical and billing systems.

Denial Information: Procedure/diagnosis code inconsistencies, invalid codes, or billing errors
ACTION: Verify diagnosis code supports medical necessity for the procedure billed.
APPEAL_TIPS: Submit clinical documentation showing diagnosis supports the procedure; reference LCD/NCD guidelines.

PREVENTION: Use Diagnosis-to-CPT crosswalk tool; implement LCD/NCD edits in billing system.

CARC Description*: The date of death precedes the date of service.
CORE-defined Business Scenario - Descrip: Missing/Invalid/Incomplete Data from Submitted Claim
Denial Information: Patient not eligible or coverage issues
ACTION: Verify date of service - cannot bill for services after patient date of death.
APPEAL_TIPS: If DOD is incorrect in payer system, provide death certificate or proof of correct DOD; this is typically not appealable if DOD is accurate.
COMMON_CAUSES: Service date after patient death; incorrect DOD in payer system; claim submitted for deceased patient in error.
PREVENTION: Implement DOD validation at scheduling/registration; check eligibility before service.

CARC Description*: The date of birth follows the date of service.
CORE-defined Business Scenario - Descrip: Missing/Invalid/Incomplete Data from Submitted Claim
Denial Information: Patient not eligible or coverage issues
ACTION: Verify patient date of birth - DOB cannot be after the date of service.
APPEAL_TIPS: Correct DOB in patient demographics and resubmit; provide birth certificate if payer DOB is incorrect.
COMMON_CAUSES: DOB entry error; newborn not yet registered; DOB typo in billing system.
PREVENTION: Implement DOB validation against DOS; use government-issued ID to verify DOB at check-in.

Refer to the 835 Healthcare Policy Identification Segment (loop 2110 Service Payment Information REF), if present.
RARC Description*: Diagnostic tests performed by a physician must indicate whether purchased services are included on the claim.

CARC Description*: Exact duplicate claim/service (Use only with Group Code OA except where state workers' compensation regulations requires CO)
CORE-defined Business Scenario - Descrip: Missing/Invalid/Incomplete Data from Submitted Claim
Denial Information: Duplicate claim submission
ACTION: Verify if claim was previously submitted and paid; check for crossover claim processing.
APPEAL_TIPS: Provide the Primary EOB showing this wasn't a duplicate; if different DOS or service, clarify in appeal.
COMMON_CAUSES: Same claim submitted twice; electronic and paper submission; crossover already processed; resubmission without void.
PREVENTION: Implement duplicate claim detection before submission; track claim status before resubmitting.

CARC Description*: This is a work-related injury/illness and thus the liability of the Worker's Compensation Carrier.
CORE-defined Business Scenario - Descrip: Billed Service Not Covered by Health Plan
Denial Information: Coordination of benefits or other payer liable
ACTION: Determine if injury is work-related; bill Workers' Compensation carrier if applicable.
APPEAL_TIPS: If not work-related, provide documentation (patient statement, physician notes) proving injury is not WC.
COMMON_CAUSES: Work-related injury not billed to WC; diagnosis codes suggest occupational injury; WC should be primary.
PREVENTION: Ask "Was this injury work-related?" at intake; identify WC claims during registration.

RARC Description*: The information furnished does not substantiate the need for this level of service. If you believe the service should have been fully covered as billed, or if you did not know and could not reasonably have been expected to know that we would not pay for this level of service, or if you notified the patient in writing in advance that we would not pay for this level of service and he/she agreed in writing to pay, ask us to review your claim within 120 days of the date of this notice.  If you do not request an appeal, we will, upon application from the patient, reimburse him/her for the amount you have collected from him/her in excess of any deductible and coinsurance amounts. We will recover the reimbursement from you as an overpayment.

RARC Description*: The information furnished does not substantiate the need for this level of service. If you believe the service should have been fully covered as billed, or if you did not know and could not reasonably have been expected to know that we would not pay for this level of service, or if you notified the patient in writing in advance that we would not pay for this level of service and he/she agreed in writing to pay, ask us to review your claim within 120 days of the date of this notice. If you do not request an appeal, we will, upon application from the patient, reimburse him/her for the amount you have collected from him/her in excess of any deductible and coinsurance amounts. We will recover the reimbursement from you as an overpayment.

RARC Description*: The information furnished does not substantiate the need for this level of service. If you have collected any amount from the patient for this level of service /any amount that exceeds the limiting charge for the less extensive service, the law requires you to refund that amount to the patient within 30 days of receiving this notice.  The requirements for refund are in 1824(I) of the Social Security Act and 42CFR411.408. The section specifies that physicians who knowingly and willfully fail to make appropriate refunds may be subject to civil monetary penalties and/or exclusion from the program. If you have any questions about this notice, please contact this office.

RARC Description*: Payment has been (denied for the/made only for a less extensive) service/item because the information furnished does not substantiate the need for the (more extensive) service/item. If you have collected any amount from the patient, you must refund that amount to the patient within 30 days of receiving this notice.  The requirements for a refund are in 1834(a)(18) of the Social Security Act (and in 1834(j)(4) and 1879(h) by cross-reference to 1834(a)(18)). Section 1834(a)(18)(B) specifies that suppliers which knowingly and willfully fail to make appropriate refunds may be subject to civil money penalties and/or exclusion from the Medicare program. If you have any questions about this notice, please contact this office.

PREVENTION: Implement date validation; ensure billing date is on or after service date.

CARC Description*: Procedure/product not approved by the Food and Drug Administration.
CORE-defined Business Scenario - Descrip: Billed Service Not Covered by Health Plan
Denial Information: Service excluded from benefit plan or not eligible for coverage
ACTION: Verify FDA approval status for procedure/product; provide FDA clearance documentation if available.
APPEAL_TIPS: Submit FDA approval letter or 510(k) clearance; provide clinical evidence if off-label use.
COMMON_CAUSES: Device/drug not FDA approved; off-label use; investigational device.
PREVENTION: Verify FDA status before using new devices/drugs; check payer coverage policies.

CARC Description*: The advance indemnification notice signed by the patient did not comply with requirements.

Denial Information: Missing or incomplete documentation from provider or patient
ACTION: Review ABN/advance notice; ensure it meets all required elements.
APPEAL_TIPS: Submit compliant ABN if available; if not executed properly, write off as provider liability.
COMMON_CAUSES: ABN not signed; ABN missing required elements; ABN executed after service.
PREVENTION: Use current ABN forms; train staff on ABN requirements; execute before service.

CARC Description*: Transportation is only covered to the closest facility that can provide the necessary care.

PREVENTION: Document medical necessity for transport destination; justify if not closest facility.

CORE-defined Business Scenario - Descrip: Missing/Invalid/Incomplete Data from Submitted Claim
Denial Information: Benefit limits reached or plan limitations apply
ACTION: Review prior claim processing details; verify original claim number, dates of service, and payment amounts match payer records. Correct discrepancies and resubmit.
APPEAL_TIPS: Include copy of original remittance advice (ERA/EOB); provide correct claim control number; attach documentation showing accurate prior processing details.
COMMON_CAUSES: Incorrect original claim reference number; mismatched dates of service on adjustment; prior payment amount discrepancy; wrong original claim control number.
PREVENTION: Maintain detailed claim tracking logs; verify original claim numbers before submitting adjustments; implement claim reconciliation processes.

CARC Description*: Payer deems the information submitted does not support this level of service.
CORE-defined Business Scenario - Descrip: Billed Service Not Covered by Health Plan
Denial Information: Service deemed not medically necessary by payer
ACTION: Review level of service documentation; ensure documentation supports level billed.
APPEAL_TIPS: Submit additional clinical documentation supporting the level of service.
COMMON_CAUSES: Documentation doesn't support level billed; E&M level too high; service intensity not documented.
PREVENTION: Ensure documentation matches level billed; train providers on documentation requirements.

CARC Description*: Payer deems the information submitted does not support this level of service.
RARC Description*: The information furnished does not substantiate the need for this level of service. If you believe the service should have been fully covered as billed, or if you did not know and could not reasonably have been expected to know that we would not pay for this level of service, or if you notified the patient in writing in advance that we would not pay for this level of service and he/she agreed in writing to pay, ask us to review your claim within 120 days of the date of this notice.  If you do not request an appeal, we will, upon application from the patient, reimburse him/her for the amount you have collected from him/her in excess of any deductible and coinsurance amounts. We will recover the reimbursement from you as an overpayment.
CORE-defined Business Scenario - Descrip: Billed Service Not Covered by Health Plan

CARC Description*: Payer deems the information submitted does not support this level of service.
RARC Description*: The information furnished does not substantiate the need for this level of service. If you have collected any amount from the patient for this level of service /any amount that exceeds the limiting charge for the less extensive service, the law requires you to refund that amount to the patient within 30 days of receiving this notice. The requirements for refund are in 1824(I) of the Social Security Act and 42CFR411.408. The section specifies that physicians who knowingly and willfully fail to make appropriate refunds may be subject to civil monetary penalties and/or exclusion from the program. If you have any questions about this notice, please contact this office.

CARC Description*: Payer deems the information submitted does not support this level of service.
RARC Description*: Payment has been (denied for the/made only for a less extensive) service/item because the information furnished does not substantiate the need for the (more extensive) service/item. If you have collected any amount from the patient, you must refund that amount to the patient within 30 days of receiving this notice. The requirements for a refund are in 1834(a)(18) of the Social Security Act (and in 1834(j)(4) and 1879(h) by cross-reference to 1834(a)(18)). Section 1834(a)(18)(B) specifies that suppliers which knowingly and willfully fail to make appropriate refunds may be subject to civil money penalties and/or exclusion from the Medicare program. If you have any questions about this notice, please contact this office.

RARC Description*: The information furnished does not substantiate the need for this level of service. If you believe the service should have been fully covered as billed, or if you did not know and could not reasonably have been expected to know that we would not pay for this level of service, or if you notified the patient in writing in advance that we would not pay for this level of service and he/she agreed in writing to pay, ask us to review your claim within 120 days of the date of this notice. If you do not request an appeal, we will, upon application from the patient, reimburse him/her for the amount you have collected from him/her in excess of any deductible and coinsurance amounts. We will recover the reimbursement from you as an overpayment.

A copy of this policy is available at www.cms.gov/mcd/search.asp. If you do not have web access, you may contact the contractor to request a copy of the NCD.
CORE-defined Business Scenario - Descrip: Billed Service Not Covered by Health Plan
Denial Information: Missing or incomplete documentation from provider or patient
ACTION: Verify prescribing/ordering provider's eligibility and credentials; confirm DEA registration (if applicable), state license, and payer enrollment.
APPEAL_TIPS: Submit prescribing provider's active license and enrollment documentation; provide DEA certificate if controlled substance; if provider info incorrect, correct and resubmit.
COMMON_CAUSES: Prescriber not enrolled with payer; DEA registration expired or invalid; prescriber lacks authority to order specific service; scope of practice limitations; incorrect ordering provider NPI.
PREVENTION: Verify ordering provider credentials before fulfilling orders; maintain current DEA/license expiration dates; implement ordering provider validation.

CARC Description*: This product/procedure is only covered when used according to FDA recommendations.
CORE-defined Business Scenario - Descrip: Billed Service Not Covered by Health Plan
Denial Information: Service deemed not medically necessary by payer
ACTION: Verify product/procedure is used according to FDA recommendations.
APPEAL_TIPS: Submit documentation showing FDA-compliant use; provide clinical justification if off-label.
COMMON_CAUSES: Off-label use; non-FDA approved indication; dosing outside FDA guidelines.
PREVENTION: Follow FDA labeling; document medical necessity for any off-label use.

CARC Description*: 'Not otherwise classified' or 'unlisted' procedure code (CPT/HCPCS) was billed when there is a specific procedure code for this procedure/service.
CORE-defined Business Scenario - Descrip: Missing/Invalid/Incomplete Data from Submitted Claim
Denial Information: Procedure/diagnosis code inconsistencies, invalid codes, or billing errors
ACTION: Provide description and documentation for unlisted/NOC code.
APPEAL_TIPS: Submit detailed description, invoice, and medical necessity for unlisted procedure.
COMMON_CAUSES: Unlisted code used without description; NOC requires additional documentation.
PREVENTION: Include detailed descriptions for unlisted codes; use specific codes when available.

CARC Description*: Payment is included in the allowance for a Skilled Nursing Facility (SNF) qualified stay.
CORE-defined Business Scenario - Descrip: Benefit for Billed Service Not Separately Payable
Denial Information: Service bundled with another payment
ACTION: Verify if service is included in SNF consolidated billing.
APPEAL_TIPS: If service is excluded from SNF CB, submit documentation; verify exclusion list.
COMMON_CAUSES: Service included in SNF PPS; consolidated billing applies; SNF bundled service.
PREVENTION: Verify SNF consolidated billing requirements; check exclusion lists.

CARC Description*: Payment is included in the allowance for a Skilled Nursing Facility (SNF) qualified stay.
RARC Description*: Payment for services furnished to Skilled Nursing Facility (SNF) inpatients (except for excluded services) can only be made to the SNF. You must request payment from the SNF rather than the patient for this service.

CARC Description*: Payment is included in the allowance for a Skilled Nursing Facility (SNF) qualified stay.
RARC Description*: Services furnished to Skilled Nursing Facility (SNF) inpatients must be billed on the inpatient claim. They cannot be billed separately as outpatient services.
CORE-defined Business Scenario - Descrip: Benefit for Billed Service Not Separately Payable

ACTION: Verify if service is included in SNF consolidated billing.

PREVENTION: Verify SNF consolidated billing requirements; check exclusion lists.

CARC Description*: Payment is included in the allowance for a Skilled Nursing Facility (SNF) qualified stay.

Denial Information: Service bundled with another payment
ACTION: Verify if service is included in SNF consolidated billing.
APPEAL_TIPS: If service is excluded from SNF CB, submit documentation; verify exclusion list.

ACTION: Review if authorized services/dates/units were exceeded.
APPEAL_TIPS: Request additional authorization; submit clinical justification for excess services.
COMMON_CAUSES: Exceeded authorized units; dates of service outside auth period; services beyond auth scope.
PREVENTION: Track authorized units/dates; request auth extensions before exceeding.

CARC Description*: Precertification/notification/authorization/pre-treatment exceeded.

CARC Description*: Revenue code and Procedure code do not match.
CORE-defined Business Scenario - Descrip: Missing/Invalid/Incomplete Data from Submitted Claim
Denial Information: Procedure/diagnosis code inconsistencies, invalid codes, or billing errors
ACTION: Correct revenue code to match procedure code.
APPEAL_TIPS: Resubmit with correct revenue/procedure code combination.
COMMON_CAUSES: Revenue code doesn't match CPT/HCPCS; incorrect revenue code assignment.
PREVENTION: Use revenue code to CPT crosswalk; verify code combinations.

CARC Description*: Expenses incurred during lapse in coverage.

ACTION: Verify coverage during lapse period; determine if retroactive coverage applies.
APPEAL_TIPS: If coverage was reinstated retroactively, submit proof; otherwise bill patient.
COMMON_CAUSES: Coverage lapsed during service date; COBRA lapse; premium not paid.
PREVENTION: Verify active coverage status; check for lapses before service.

CARC Description*: Patient is responsible for amount of this claim/service through 'set aside arrangement' or other agreement. (Use only with Group Code PR). CARC Description*: National Provider Identifier - missing.
CORE-defined Business Scenario - Descrip: Missing/Invalid/Incomplete Data from Submitted Claim
Denial Information: Procedure/diagnosis code inconsistencies, invalid codes, or billing errors
ACTION: Identify which provider's NPI is missing (billing, rendering, referring, ordering, etc.); add the required NPI and resubmit the claim.
APPEAL_TIPS: This is not appealable; simply add the missing NPI and resubmit. Verify NPI is active at NPPES (https://npiregistry.cms.hhs.gov).
COMMON_CAUSES: NPI field left blank on claim form; required secondary NPI not submitted; loop/segment for specific provider type omitted; clearinghouse stripping NPI.
PREVENTION: Implement pre-submission NPI validation; require NPI for all provider fields; verify claim form completeness before submission.

APPEAL_TIPS: This is not appealable; correct the NPI format and resubmit. NPIs must be exactly 10 digits with valid check digit per Luhn algorithm.
COMMON_CAUSES: NPI entered with wrong number of digits; typo in NPI; non-numeric characters included; legacy provider number used instead of NPI; check digit incorrect.
PREVENTION: Implement NPI format validation (10 digits, Luhn check); use NPI lookup during data entry; validate NPIs against NPPES before claim submission.

CORE-defined Business Scenario - Descrip: Missing/Invalid/Incomplete Data from Submitted Claim
Denial Information: Procedure/diagnosis code inconsistencies, invalid codes, or billing errors
ACTION: Verify NPI-to-provider matching in payer's system; confirm provider enrollment is complete and NPI is linked to correct Tax ID and provider information.
APPEAL_TIPS: Submit provider enrollment confirmation; include NPPES verification showing correct NPI; if NPI/TIN mismatch, provide W-9 and enrollment documentation.
COMMON_CAUSES: Provider not enrolled with payer; NPI not linked to Tax ID in payer system; provider information mismatch (name, address, taxonomy); group vs individual NPI confusion; recent NPI change not updated.
PREVENTION: Complete provider enrollment before billing; verify NPI enrollment status with each payer; update payer records when provider information changes.

CARC Description*: Payment adjusted because pre-certification/authorization not received in a timely fashion
CORE-defined Business Scenario - Descrip: Billed Service Not Covered by Health Plan
Denial Information: Missing, expired, or exceeded pre-authorization
ACTION: Obtain precertification/authorization within required time frame.
APPEAL_TIPS: Request retro-authorization; submit documentation for emergency or time-sensitive services.
COMMON_CAUSES: Authorization obtained late; notification not timely; pre-cert after service.
PREVENTION: Obtain authorization before service; understand timing requirements.

CARC Description*: Administrative surcharges are not covered.
CORE-defined Business Scenario - Descrip: Billed Service Not Covered by Health Plan
Denial Information: Service excluded from benefit plan or not eligible for coverage
ACTION: Verify if administrative surcharges are covered under plan.
APPEAL_TIPS: N/A - Administrative surcharges are typically non-covered.
COMMON_CAUSES: Administrative fee billed; handling charge; non-medical surcharge.
PREVENTION: Do not bill administrative surcharges to insurance; bill patient if applicable.

CARC Description*: Administrative surcharges are not covered.
RARC Description*: The billed service(s) are not considered medical expenses.

CARC Description*: Non-compliance with the physician self referral prohibition legislation or payer policy.
CORE-defined Business Scenario - Descrip: Billed Service Not Covered by Health Plan
Denial Information: Missing or incomplete documentation from provider or patient
ACTION: Review referral relationship for Stark Law or Anti-Kickback compliance; verify the referral does not violate self-referral prohibition rules.
APPEAL_TIPS: If compliant, submit documentation proving referral meets Stark Law exceptions (e.g., in-office ancillary services exception, fair market value arrangement); provide compliance officer attestation.
COMMON_CAUSES: Designated health service referred to entity with financial relationship; self-referral without qualifying exception; prohibited compensation arrangement.
PREVENTION: Implement Stark Law compliance monitoring; maintain documentation of qualifying exceptions; consult compliance officer for questionable referrals.

PREVENTION: Track contracted limits; request increases if medically necessary.

CARC Description*: Service not payable per managed care contract.
CORE-defined Business Scenario - Descrip: Billed Service Not Covered by Health Plan
Denial Information: Network restrictions or referral requirements not met
ACTION: Review managed care contract terms to determine why service is not payable; verify if service is carved out, capitated, or specifically excluded.
APPEAL_TIPS: If service should be covered per contract, submit relevant contract language; if emergent or out-of-area, submit supporting documentation; contact payer's provider relations.
COMMON_CAUSES: Service carved out of contract; service included in capitation; contract-specific exclusion; out-of-network for this service type; fee schedule limitation.
PREVENTION: Maintain current managed care contract summaries; verify service payability before rendering; understand carve-out and capitation arrangements.

CARC Description*: Service not payable per managed care contract.
RARC Description*: Records indicate this patient was a prisoner or in custody of a Federal, State, or local authority when the service was rendered. This  payer does not cover items and services furnished to an individual while he or she is in custody under a penal statute or rule, unless under State or local law, the individual is personally liable for the cost of his or her health care while in custody and the State or local government pursues the collection of such debt in the same way and with the same vigor as the collection of its other debts. RARC Description*: Records indicate this patient was a prisoner or in custody of a Federal, State, or local authority when the service was rendered. This  payer does not cover items and services furnished to an individual while he or she is in custody under a penal statute or rule, unless under State or local law, the individual is personally liable for the cost of his or her health care while in custody and the State or local government pursues the collection of such debt in the same way and with the same vigor as the collection of its other debts. The provider can collect from the Federal/State/ Local Authority as appropriate.

CARC Description*: Only one visit or consultation per physician per day is covered.
RARC Description*: The information furnished does not substantiate the need for this level of service. If you believe the service should have been fully covered as billed, or if you did not know and could not reasonably have been expected to know that we would not pay for this level of service, or if you notified the patient in writing in advance that we would not pay for this level of service and he/she agreed in writing to pay, ask us to review your claim within 120 days of the date of this notice.  If you do not request an appeal, we will, upon application from the patient, reimburse him/her for the amount you have collected from him/her in excess of any deductible and coinsurance amounts. We will recover the reimbursement from you as an overpayment.

CARC Description*: Only one visit or consultation per physician per day is covered.
RARC Description*: The information furnished does not substantiate the need for this level of service. If you have collected any amount from the patient for this level of service /any amount that exceeds the limiting charge for the less extensive service, the law requires you to refund that amount to the patient within 30 days of receiving this notice.  The requirements for refund are in 1824(I) of the Social Security Act and 42CFR411.408. The section specifies that physicians who knowingly and willfully fail to make appropriate refunds may be subject to civil monetary penalties and/or exclusion from the program. If you have any questions about this notice, please contact this office.

PREVENTION: Identify hospice patients; verify billing requirements.

CARC Description*: Patient is enrolled in a Hospice.
RARC Description*: The information furnished does not substantiate the need for this level of service. If you believe the service should have been fully covered as billed, or if you did not know and could not reasonably have been expected to know that we would not pay for this level of service, or if you notified the patient in writing in advance that we would not pay for this level of service and he/she agreed in writing to pay, ask us to review your claim within 120 days of the date of this notice.  If you do not request an appeal, we will, upon application from the patient, reimburse him/her for the amount you have collected from him/her in excess of any deductible and coinsurance amounts. We will recover the reimbursement from you as an overpayment.

If adjustment is at the Line Level, the payer must send and the provider should refer to the 835 Healthcare Policy Identification Segment (loop 2110 Service Payment information REF) if the regulations apply. To be used for Property and Casualty Auto only.
RARC Description*: Benefits are no longer available based on a final injury settlement.

CARC Description*: Workers' Compensation claim adjudicated as non-compensable. This Payer not liable for claim or service/treatment. Usage: If adjustment is at the Claim Level, the payer must send and the provider should refer to the 835 Insurance Policy Number Segment (Loop 2100 Other Claim Related Information REF qualifier 'IG') for the jurisdictional regulation. If adjustment is at the Line Level, the payer must send and the provider should refer to the 835 Healthcare Policy Identification Segment (loop 2110 Service Payment information REF). To be used for Workers' Compensation only
CORE-defined Business Scenario - Descrip: Billed Service Not Covered by Health Plan
Denial Information: Workers' Compensation related
ACTION: Review WC non-compensable determination; verify alternate coverage.
APPEAL_TIPS: Appeal WC determination; submit to health insurance if upheld.
COMMON_CAUSES: WC claim denied as non-compensable; not work-related per WC.
PREVENTION: Verify WC compensability; have alternate insurance information.

CARC Description*: The applicable fee schedule/fee database does not contain the billed code. Please resubmit a bill with the appropriate fee schedule/fee database code(s) that best describe the service(s) provided and supporting documentation if required. To be used for Property and Casualty only.

ACTION: Contact payer for fee schedule rates; code may not be in system.
APPEAL_TIPS: Request manual pricing; submit cost documentation.

PREVENTION: Verify code is in fee schedule before billing; use alternate code if available.
